derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French billard, denoting both the game and the cue, diminutive of bille (see billet)

entry.def: Billiards is a game played on a large table, in which you use a long stick called a cue to hit balls against each other or into pockets around the sides of the table.
Billiards is a game played on a large table, in which you use a long stick called a cue to hit balls against each other or against the walls around the sides of the table.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several games played on rectangular cloth-covered table (with cushioned edges) in which long tapering cue sticks are used to propel ivory (or composition) balls
